notes_text: Banned in 1870. Cannabis is a Class A drug under the Misuse of Drugs Act, making it illegal to cultivate, sell, or possess. Those who are caught with 500 g of cannabis or more are considered drug traffickers and are liable to be punished with an automatic death penalty. In rare cases, permission has been granted to use cannabis-derived pharmaceuticals for treatment of epilepsy.
